text: *Can any developer help me with this question? The support told me to ask here because they couldn't answer.*

I'm currently tracking form submissions to another analytics tool by using the method of listening to global events (window.addEventListener('message', event => {
  if(event.data.type === 'hsFormCallback' && event.data.eventName === 'onFormSubmitted') { etc ). This code is deployed on the pages with forms and the forms are embedded in iframes. But this solution seems to working on some forms and not working on some other forms, and I don't know why
Hi
I need your help Please help me its very urgent

I check the documentation you provided and successfully implement the functionality with CURL request, BUT we need to implement the API with jQuery. When I use API URL with ajax request then I face CORS error

Please let me know how we can resolve this

If you're making the call from a CMS Hub website, then you could consider using serverless functions. This is also best practice for keeping your bearer token secret.

Or, if you're calling from a different website platform, do you have access to server-side controllers on the same domain that could relay the requests to the HubSpot API?
Hi <@U03FGHYTZPF>
I'm new to HubSpot, I don't really understand anything, how can you help me further?
What should I tell you more and solve this problem of mine, I have to do this today, it is very important for me.
I have prepared all the code, I have tried it in PHP and it is working well, but I have to work with JS and I need these records in WEBFLOW.

Hello,
I'm trying to use the files API (<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/files/files>) but I encounter an error at the very first step! I already `pip install --upgrade HubSpot-api-client`
could someone help me here?
Thanks a lot!
You'll want to use a serverless function to proxy the api calls
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/serverless-functions>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/data/serverless-functions/reference#serverless-json>

Do you want to just do this instead:
```import HubSpot
from pprint import pprint
from HubSpot.files import ApiException```

It's still blocking when trying to import the ApiException
`cannot import name 'ApiException' from 'HubSpot.files' (C:\Python311\Lib\site-packages\HubSpot\files\__init__.py)`
What is weird, is that in another script, I successfully import the contacts API. It seems like the issue only happens with the files API
yeah that's very interesting, Honestly I hate using all the SDKs I just use then endpoints directly with requests
My superior is a bit worried with importing files without using the SDK, we fear that uploading 80 Gb of data might require a good "retry" handling :slightly_smiling_face:
yeah, I would personally would still use the endpoints with exponential backoff.
that's just me though, I'm weird like that
Thanks for the hint. I'll see how I can work around this one

I need help finding the property value date of a deal owner that is shown under assigned to on a deal. My company had a field added under deal owner called "osc_owner" to track who sets the appointment for a deal. I have read through a bunch of the deals, and owner documentation and I can't find how to pull back the date shown on the property detail of *"11/9/2023 at 12:00 PM MST"* 

when I call back the deal this is what I'm using in python to do it.
    *api_response = client.crm.deals.basic_api.get_by_id(deal_id=id, properties=["osc_owner", "lead_source"], archived=False)* 

*here is what i get back when I do a call similar to the line above.*
{"results":[{"id":"11065285214",
"properties":{"amount":null,
"closedate":"2022-11-23T16:47:21.244Z",
"createdate":"2022-11-23T16:46:50.630Z",
"dealname":"Cade Cooper -RPA103",
"dealstage":"54908291",
"hs_lastmodifieddate":"2023-11-10T17:14:55.286Z",
"hs_object_id":"11065285214",
"pipeline":"default"},
"createdAt":"2022-11-23T16:46:50.630Z",
"updatedAt":"2023-11-10T17:14:
'osc_owner': '234118221

now that I have the osc_owner id I call the owner api because that is where the support told me I would find the date that is was added to the deal but the dates that come from this api call.
      *api_response = client.crm.owners.owners_api.get_by_id(owner_id=owner_id, id_property="id", archived=False)*
Here is the response from this line
{'id': '234118221',
'email': '<mailto:kmarshall@visionaryhomes.com|kmarshall@visionaryhomes.com>',
'first_name': 'Kennedy',
'last_name': 'Marshall',
'user_id': 47052413,
'created_at': datetime.datetime(2022, 9, 21, 16, 12, 57, 184000,tzinfo=tzutc()),
 'updated_at': datetime.datetime(2023, 9, 27, 14, 15, 11, 829000, tzinfo=tzutc()),
'archived': False,
'teams': None}
as you can see the dates are for the owner information and not when it was assigned to the deal.

Am I missing a property field that I need to add to get "11/9/2023 at 12:00 PM MST"  pulled back in the api? I just really need the time that Kennedy was assigned to the deal not when the deal was made or last updated but when she was assigned to the deal and that is what the support can't help me find and I can't find in the documentation so far.
You can use the propertiesWithHistory parameter to pull the update history for that particular property and the time stamps

So do I just put propertieswithhistory in my code like this?

api_response = client.crm.deals.basic_api.get_by_id(deal_id=id, properties=["osc_owner", "lead_source","propertiesWithHistory"], archived=False)
I don't know exactly how to do it with the SDK, but I assume it's just adding it as another parameter just like the properties

<@U05F0T2AJKA> thanks for the suggestion! I did find a couple useful youtube tutorials. Also getting familiar with the HubSpot standard workspace on postman was a big help to get me going. Have a good weekend!
